Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the significance of the thirteen folds in the U.S. flag folding tradition by ascribing specific meanings to each fold.
Understate: The claim may be understating the fact that the folds are not actually performed because of the specific meanings assigned to them.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support or evidence to back up the assertion that each fold has a special meaning.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the folding of the U.S. flag incorporates thirteen separate folds because each fold has a special meaning, which may be a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert suggests that the meanings assigned to the folds are after-the-fact and may not be the original purpose of the folding tradition, indicating the existence of alternative explanations.
